intro: Genosiris glabrata, commonly known as the smooth genosiris, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its upright, slender stems and lance-shaped leaves that are smooth and glabrous. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences with greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. Native to parts of North America, it thrives in moist, sandy soils along streambanks and wetlands. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
